screens.headline: Collect credit like a condor, peak like a butterfly
screens.text: Iron butterfly = short ATM straddle with wings. Bigger credit than condors, narrower profit zone.

screens.headline: Iron Butterfly = Short ATM straddle + protective wings
screens.text: Sell ATM call and ATM put at the same strike (short straddle), then buy further OTM call and put as wings to define risk. Max profit at the center; max loss = wing width minus credit.

screens.headline: Aggressive insurance selling
screens.text: Condor: insure a wide range â†’ smaller premium. Iron butterfly: insure a tiny range right at the current price â†’ much larger premium. Trade-off: much narrower profit zone.

screens.question: Compared to an iron condor, an iron butterfly typically has:
screens.explanation_correct: Right. Shorting ATM options collects maximum premium; the wings cap risk.
screens.explanation_wrong: Iron butterflies sell ATM options, which collect more premium than OTM condors.

screens.question: AAPL iron butterfly: short $180 call/put, long $185 call and $175 put, net credit $8. Where is max profit?
screens.explanation_correct: Max profit occurs at the center strike where both short options expire worthless.
screens.explanation_wrong: Unlike condors, the iron butterfly peaks at the center short strike.
